forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of drizzle before 4am, then a chance of rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. South wind 8 to 12 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Veterans Day
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely before 4pm, then a slight chance of drizzle. Mostly cloudy. High near 61, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 10 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In the early hours of Veterans Day, a muted serenity blankets Downtown San Francisco, with soft whispers of drizzle teasing the dawn. There's an unmistakable chill in the air as temperatures hover around a mild 54 degrees, while a gentle south wind stirs restlessly, hinting at the changes to come. The clouds weave a thick tapestry overhead, softening the outlines of the iconic skyline—an ethereal view that speaks to the city's ruggedness.

As the day unfolds, the weather promises a dance of rain. By mid-afternoon, the likelihood of showers escalates, suggesting a cozy retreat is in order. While the high is tentative, peaking near 61 degrees before retreating into a cooler embrace, it’s the gusty winds, pushing up to 28 mph, that will make their presence known. Those venturing out should layer thoughtfully—a light waterproof jacket will serve well against both the coolness and the potential for rain. 

For a day such as this, consider taking in the city’s café culture; a thoughtfully brewed cup of coffee enjoyed in a tucked-away corner, as good friends share stories over the steady rhythm of raindrops dancing on the window. Alternatively, the eclectic atmosphere of a local bookstore beckons, ideal for losing oneself in the pages of a novel as the world outside transforms under the sway of the clouds.
